basics.name: Tyson J. Hayes
basics.label: Dev/Ops Engineer
basics.summary: I am looking to expand my development career. I have found a love of writing and maintaining code.  The challenges that come with this work have kept me busy for a while and I am looking to move to more challenging software development engineer or DevOps roles.  If it runs on Windows I want to be able to tear it apart, patch it, and get it back out the door. I would also love to be able to architect and release some of my own programs that suite the business needs.

references.name: Adam Gates
references.reference: I worked with Tyson in support of the Office 365 Exchange service for Microsoft's Dedicated, Internal, and Development Exchange Environments. While on my team Tyson was very successful as the Technical Lead and in that role was the escalation point for up to 20 other engineers. I relied on Tyson to be the point person for the most difficult, visible, and largest impacting issues. He regularly took on issues that impacted 200k+ users calmly, clearly, and with deep technical ability repeatedly and successfully resolving issues with deep insight that led to changing the service and product. Tyson has a natural talent for technology, is an excellent resource for his peers, an inspiring technical leader, and is an all-around great engineer. I look forward to any opportunity to work with Tyson in the future.

references.name: Marie Casey
references.reference: Tyson goes out of his way to study, learn, and practice skills and competencies that enable him to achieve more, no matter the job he is working. He also leverages his learning to advance his entire group, which really sets him apart. Tyson is more than a valuable addition to any workplace: his willingness to share, mentor, and enrich makes him an asset that multiples value in a team.

references.name: Thanh Thai
references.reference: Tyson played a significant role in assisting with the deployment of Exchange 2013 within our beta testing environment. His focus was on documentation and automating the deployment which made upgrading and handling the environment off to our Operations team smooth. His scripting and programming skills were displayed and evolved over this period of time.

references.name: Mark Jones
references.reference: Tyson is a very detailed, creative and self-motivated individual. I know that the project he was working for me on was severely hampered when he was pulled off. I would be glad to have Tyson on any project I was heading up or working on.

references.name: Cory Odegard
references.reference: I have had the opportunity work with Tyson over the last few years and I highly recommend Tyson. He is detail oriented and ensures when a task is assigned he fully understands the scope and desired outcome then works extremely hard to attain or exceed stated goals. His knowledge and understanding of the technologies he works with is impressive and I would happily take the opportunity to work with him, directly or otherwise, at any point in the future.

references.name: Kjell Andorson
references.reference: It is my distinct pleasure to write this recommendation for Tyson who was widely known and respected within our org as not just a top-notch engineer, but a scripting guru that constantly worked to improve and automate tasks within our environment and who could be counted on to find elegant solutions to complex problems. His insight and dedication helped save countless man-hours of labor and his efforts were praised by management and fellow engineers alike. Tyson would be a great asset to any technical team and I can't recommend him highly enough.

references.name: Jason Raney
references.reference: Tyson is one of the smartest guys I know. He not only is able to write extremely well in multiple programing languages, but he makes it understandable and easy to read. His experience and abilities with Microsoft Exchange is excellent and was able to help me out of a bind multiple times.  The tools he has developed are very intuitive and easy to use, at the same time powerful and time saving. I would recommend Tyson for any job that would require someone to have excellent work ethics, be reliable, and have a strong skill in writing tools and automation for Microsoft products.

references.name: Hillary Crenshaw
references.reference: In our many years of association Tyson has constantly proved himself to be not only a gifted writer and talented developer, but also a master of social media and all things tech. As marketing strategist for Apathy Games he has been the wizard behind our media presence, working tirelessly to promote and expand our company’s place in the gaming and internet communities. Tyson’s writing and work for our website and recent RPG game exemplifies the creativity and wit that makes working alongside him a true pleasure.
